page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA
page.content: The area lies at the northern end of the "island" of Lothingland and is a mixture of agricultural and residential land. The area contains large parts of the parishes of Bradwell and Burgh Castle, and small parts of Belton and Gorleston-on-Sea. { Bradwell}is a large village of over 7000 people. It has been growing since the war, but the major growth has been in the last 20 years.The majority of houses are privately owned. { Burgh Castle}is still a small village, but it provides chalet and caravan accomodation for tourists at several locations; this area being part of the Norfolk Broads. A major development of the 1970's has been the growth of an industrial estate, known as{Harfrey's estate.} This light industrial area is still expanding.
